CatDescriptText: Mr. Charles W. Day, 1835 Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 7, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think adults in the community are doing enough to foster constructive recreational activities, like playgrounds, centers, places to dance, Little Leagues, etc., for youth?" answer reads: "No, I don't think so. Take Ammon Center for instance.  There are too many people using the services of one pool.  Here in Pittsburgh we are a little behind.  For instance, in Wilmington, Del., and Philadelphia, where I lived, they have teen-age dances every night and Saturday they are televised.  The parents just have to look at television to know where the kids are."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles W. Day, wearing moustache, light colored shirt with stand up collar, and trench coat, standing in front of block wall with windows on either side
